intro: Tephrosia gracilipes, commonly known as slender tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, and is known for its nitrogen-fixing ability. Tephrosia gracilipes is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
